IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The mission of the Foundation is to mobilize community support and resources for the academic improvement of the school system. Funds raised become part of a permanent endowment.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The mission of the Foundation is to mobilize community support and resources for the academic improvement of the Mountain Brook City School System through technological improvement, library enhancement, and professional development.
IRS990.Desc: Grant from Foundation was for technological upgrades to support use of instructional materials as well as a general grant related to Covid-19 relief.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Grant from Foundation was for professional development and training of staff at various schools in Mountain Brook School System.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Grant from the Foundation was for secondary math education at the Mountain Brook Junior High school level.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: Grant from Foundation was for enhancements to the libraries of various schools in Mountain Brook School System.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The current year balance of endowment funds consists of 2 endowed funds. One of the funds is the Margaret Spencer Ragland award, an annual award for the most outstanding educator in the Mountain Brook City School System. The other fund is restricted for the benefit of the math departments at the middle and high school levels of the school system.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Technological upgrades to support use of instructional materials
Professional development and training of staff

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation's policy is to notify grant recipients of the total grant amounts but funds are disbursed to grant receipients on a reimbursement basis.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Before the 990 is filed, an electronic copy of the entire 990 is provided to each board member. Each board member reviews the entire 990 and provides questions to the Exectuive Director who then communicates these questions to the Organzization's Form 990 preparer. Once all questions are answered, the board members electronically approve the Form 990 and it is submitted to the Internal Revenue Service.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Each director, principal officer, and member of a committee with governing board-delegated powers sign a Conflict of Interest statement.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Committee of the board is responsible for making a recommendation to the full board regarding compensation. The Finance committee of the board is responsible for making a recommendation about funding of compensation. The executive committee is a permanent committee of the board. Among the responsibilities and authority of the executive committee is that relating to executive compensation. This committee is responsible for the hiring and evaluation of the principal administrator(s) of the organization. The committee reviews compensation practices and programs for principal administrators, provides leadership in this area, and upholds the tax-exempt status of the organization. The executive committee reports its determinations to the full board. The executive committee of the board reviews and approves the compensation policies and programs of principal administrators. The policy of the foundation is to provide a compensation program that reflects the relative size and type of organization of which it is a part and which will accomplish the mission of the foundation and tax-exempt purpose without causing any part of the net earnings of the foundation to inure to the private benefit of an individual or group of individuals. The committee will accomplish this policy in the following manner: Determine the relevant market data for the principal administrator position it reviews by obtaining reliable and comparable data. Develop a target base pay range built off the median of the market data. Set base salary by considering both market data and the background experience, skills, and meritorious contribution of each individual. Set salary increase reassessments based on external equity, internal equity, and/or merit.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
